transcript.content: I was about maybe 14 or 15 years old and I was well; I don't want to say arrested but I was brought to the police department and my parents had to come and get me and I remember that and I was from that point I was arrested for a second degree attempted murder. transcript.speaker: Ron
transcript.content: They'd break out running and go this is like I mean that's dysfunctional it's not that not normal for you to do that, but I mean it was a cycle that what I was done to me I in turn practiced it on doing it to my nephews and so I indulged in smoking weed. transcript.speaker: Ron
transcript.content: So but it was an experience for me because I had been dropped in an abnormal environment. And anybody say prison is not abnormal? They have to be abnormal. Neither is the way that people were living in society in those neighborhoods and growing up in that type of environment that's not the way people supposed to live.

transcript.speaker: Ron
transcript.content: So it was a weird experience and I capitalized on it because I from that point on I had to make a decision on what road that I was going to travel and in prison there are many roads to travel and I decided that hey I know what I want to be I think I'm developing into a starting to have some thought processes in my mind of working on what I want to try and make something out of my life.

transcript.speaker: Ron
transcript.content: So it lined up that I was able to get around some people that were positive like I was saying earlier. transcript.content: So we started meeting and then we started doing training and one of the things that we encourage guys to do to write they kids that's a part of the curriculum. transcript.speaker: Ron
transcript.content: So we're like man listen you have to spend time with your kids you have to sow into your kid's life you don't want them to repeat what you're experiencing right now. transcript.content: Because they don't even its nobody well, I don't want to say anybody because I don't know, but in my situation there's nobody mediating. transcript.speaker: Ron
transcript.content: They haven't even talked and it's generations of people not communicating with each other because of a situation that took place. And I'm responsible for that. transcript.speaker: Ron
transcript.content: So not only do I express and feel remorse for the crimes that we've committed everybody I come in contact with.

transcript.content: Let me ask you something that I've been thinking quite a bit about since this project started and that is, now there are variations in there's all kinds of conduct that results in a life sentence. transcript.speaker: Ron
transcript.content: But just living life you these are things normal things that you want to do.
